item.title: 2095. Delete the Middle Node of a Linked List
item.description: 1 Description # source: https://leetcode.com/problems/delete-the-middle-node-of-a-linked-list/ You are given the head of a linked list. Delete the middle node, and return the head of the modified linked list. The middle node of a linked list of size n is the ⌊n / 2⌋th node from the start using 0-based indexing, where ⌊x⌋ denotes the largest integer less than or equal to x. For n = 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5, the middle nodes are 0, 1, 1, 2, and 2, respectively.
